page.title: 10LEISURE IN SAMPFORD
page.content: There are very few facilities in this area but in Great Sampford there is a Womens Institute, a Football club, Cricket club, (which is 200 years old), the Brownies and the Guides. For Cubs and Scouts you must journey to Thaxted or Ridgewell. There is a Badmington club which is held at the Lord Butler Leisure Centre. This is run by Andrew Wisbey, a boy who lives in the village. After that there is a session for the adults. There are many things at the Lord Butler which people from Sampford attend. Swimming and Rollerskating among them. There are a few things after school. There is a play area with a football pitch, climbing frame, swings and a slide. There is a Riding school owned by Sarah Green. Here children of almost any age can ride a horse through the village with supervision.
